info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 5:27PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN AUGLAIZE AND CENTRAL MERCER COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM EDT... At 527 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Celina, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Celina, St. Marys, Coldwater, New Bremen, Minster, St. Henry, Wabash, Chickasaw, Montezuma, Egypt, Maria Stein, Neptune, Carthagena and Bulkhead. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
